meanings.definition: The act of forming words in the throat without actually speaking them aloud.
meanings.sent1: Subvocalization can help with memorizing information by silently repeating it.
meanings.sent2: She noticed her subvocalization while practicing her speech in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: During the quiet library session, his subvocalization accidentally slipped out as a whisper.
meanings.sent4: Her subvocalization was like a secret language only she could understand.
meanings.sent5: The teacher encouraged the students to use subvocalization to improve their pronunciation.

meanings.definition: The process of silently pronouncing words in one's mind while reading.
meanings.sent1: Subvocalization is a common technique used to enhance reading comprehension.
meanings.sent2: He found that subvocalization helped him focus better during long reading assignments.
meanings.sent3: Her exaggerated subvocalization made it seem like she was narrating a story in her head.
meanings.sent4: The subvocalization in his mind was like a soft murmur guiding him through the text.
meanings.sent5: The child's subvocalization was so loud in his head, he felt like he was reading out loud.

meanings.definition: The subconscious movement of the lips and tongue when reading or thinking.
meanings.sent1: His subvocalization was evident as his lips moved slightly while he read the book.
meanings.sent2: She tried to control her subvocalization by keeping her lips still during the exam.
meanings.sent3: The funny part of his subvocalization was that his tongue seemed to dance along with the words.
meanings.sent4: The poet's subvocalization was like a silent ballet of words performed by his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The actress's subvocalization added a unique charm to her performance, even though the audience couldn't hear it.
